{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3153810,"name":"","username":"Kerol_8054","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/b487fb/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-27T18:15:06.380Z","cooked":"

We have been trying to write the Pigeon 2.0 gyro component to our robot, but last year as we attempted wiring the pigeon 2.0 to the VRM port to power it on, we had some problems like the robot shutting down due to the power consumption and so on. What is the best way to wire a pigeon 2.0 to the robot? And if any teams use pigeon 2.0, how did you wire it?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-02-27T18:15:06.380Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":744,"reads":294,"readers_count":293,"score":3778.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":428322,"topic_slug":"pigeon-2-0-wiring-and-a-power-consumption-problem","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57603,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Kerol #8054"},"post_url":"/t/pigeon-2-0-wiring-and-a-power-consumption-problem/428322/1","custom_user_title":"Kerol #8054","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3153825,"name":"Abram Devonshire","username":"abedev","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/abedev/{size}/181119_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-27T18:29:28.851Z","cooked":"

Ours is wired directly to the Rev PDH low power channels. You could use the VRM as well.

Of course, you will need to make sure it is on the CAN Network. The Phoenix Tuner software will allow you to troubleshoot that.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-02-27T18:29:28.851Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":20,"reads":286,"readers_count":285,"score":157.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":428322,"topic_slug":"pigeon-2-0-wiring-and-a-power-consumption-problem","display_username":"Abram Devonshire","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51852,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/pigeon-2-0-wiring-and-a-power-consumption-problem/428322/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3153841,"name":"","username":"Kerol_8054","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/b487fb/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-27T18:38:59.658Z","cooked":"

We have used the vrm with the modem and the pigeon at the same time and the vrm rebooted randomly.

in the datasheet, it says it draws a max of 40mA so we wired into a 12v 500mA channel and modem to a 12v 2A channel at the same vrm. Do you think it will cause any problems?

We did tests on pigeon 2.0 before the offseason on our Regional robot and we had no issues. But in the off-season robot, this issue I have mentioned above came up.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-02-27T18:38:59.658Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":10,"reads":267,"readers_count":266,"score":108.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":428322,"topic_slug":"pigeon-2-0-wiring-and-a-power-consumption-problem","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57603,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Kerol #8054"},"post_url":"/t/pigeon-2-0-wiring-and-a-power-consumption-problem/428322/3","custom_user_title":"Kerol #8054","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3154307,"name":"Brad","username":"Bmongar","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bmongar/{size}/228654_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-28T11:13:58.415Z","cooked":"

You need a different VRM, you can’t wire anything else to the VRM that is used for the radio

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-02-28T11:13:58.415Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":220,"readers_count":219,"score":94.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":428322,"topic_slug":"pigeon-2-0-wiring-and-a-power-consumption-problem","display_username":"Brad","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":57603,"username":"Kerol_8054","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/b487fb/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38557,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5126 Codenator / Electrical, CSA, FTAA, Inspector "},"post_url":"/t/pigeon-2-0-wiring-and-a-power-consumption-problem/428322/4","custom_user_title":"5126 Codenator / Electrical, CSA, FTAA, Inspector ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3154308,"name":"Nolan","username":"Quake","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/quake/{size}/236072_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-28T11:36:14.071Z","cooked":"

You can wire other things to the VRM, you just can’t wire anything else to the 12V 2A terminals (R616).

Make sure your connection regardless of location is secure and you can’t easily tug the wires out.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-02-28T11:36:14.071Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":207,"readers_count":206,"score":101.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":428322,"topic_slug":"pigeon-2-0-wiring-and-a-power-consumption-problem","display_username":"Nolan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":38557,"username":"Bmongar","name":"Brad","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bmongar/{size}/228654_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":37917,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4512AM"},"post_url":"/t/pigeon-2-0-wiring-and-a-power-consumption-problem/428322/5","custom_user_title":"4512AM","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3154311,"name":"Rich Jr","username":"rich.varone","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rich.varone/{size}/167373_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-28T12:07:44.312Z","cooked":"

While you are legally allow to use the 12V 500mA ports it’s not recommended and can cause radio power issues like you are seeing, if you need another regulated 12V rail you should add another VRM.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-02-28T12:07:44.312Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":196,"readers_count":195,"score":84.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":428322,"topic_slug":"pigeon-2-0-wiring-and-a-power-consumption-problem","display_username":"Rich Jr","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":37917,"username":"Quake","name":"Nolan","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/quake/{size}/236072_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6998,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 271 | Lead Mentor | Fabworks Discount Code: FRC271"},"post_url":"/t/pigeon-2-0-wiring-and-a-power-consumption-problem/428322/6","custom_user_title":"FRC 271 | Lead Mentor | Fabworks Discount Code: FRC271","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3154512,"name":"","username":"Kerol_8054","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/b487fb/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-28T17:44:49.815Z","cooked":"

Thanks for your suggestions, I wonder how should we wire the 2nd VRM to the PDM?

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-02-28T17:49:49.727Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":155,"readers_count":154,"score":71.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":428322,"topic_slug":"pigeon-2-0-wiring-and-a-power-consumption-problem","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":6998,"username":"rich.varone","name":"Rich Jr","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rich.varone/{size}/167373_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57603,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Kerol #8054"},"post_url":"/t/pigeon-2-0-wiring-and-a-power-consumption-problem/428322/7","custom_user_title":"Kerol #8054","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3154658,"name":"Drakxii","username":"Drakxii","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/4da419/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-28T19:12:42.591Z","cooked":"

Just wire into one of the normal power slots (like the ones you use for motor controllers) and use a lower amp breaker (<= 20amps).

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-02-28T19:12:42.591Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":136,"readers_count":135,"score":77.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":428322,"topic_slug":"pigeon-2-0-wiring-and-a-power-consumption-problem","display_username":"Drakxii","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":57603,"username":"Kerol_8054","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/b487fb/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23134,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2582/5941 Mentor, CSA, and RI "},"post_url":"/t/pigeon-2-0-wiring-and-a-power-consumption-problem/428322/8","custom_user_title":"2582/5941 Mentor, CSA, and RI ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3155809,"name":"","username":"Kerol_8054","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/b487fb/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-02T13:12:17.636Z","cooked":"

Finally, is there any problem if we connect an Ethernet switch to the 5v port of the vrm, and connect the pigeon 2.0 to the 12v port?

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-03-02T13:12:17.636Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":110,"readers_count":109,"score":52.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":428322,"topic_slug":"pigeon-2-0-wiring-and-a-power-consumption-problem","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":23134,"username":"Drakxii","name":"Drakxii","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/4da419/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57603,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Kerol #8054"},"post_url":"/t/pigeon-2-0-wiring-and-a-power-consumption-problem/428322/9","custom_user_title":"Kerol #8054","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3156002,"name":"Drakxii","username":"Drakxii","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/4da419/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-02T17:39:14.817Z","cooked":"

Nope, it’s a common way to wire those components.
